com.k2.Proxy

Class ProxyFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.k2.Proxy.ProxyFactory

  • public class ProxyFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    The proxy factory provides factory methods to get proxy classes and/or proxies of classes.
    Author:
    simon

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ProxyFactory dynamicFactory(com.k2.Proforma.ProformaLibrary library)
      Create an instance of the ProxyFactory that will generate its proxies from the given proforma library
      <T> T getProxy(java.lang.Class<T> cls, java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler handler)
      Create an instance of the proxy class for the given class and set its invocation handler to the given invocation handler
      <T> T getProxy(T target, java.lang.Class<?>... handlers)
      Get a instance implementing the AProxy interface that extends the class of the given target and linked to the given array of invocation handlers
      java.lang.Class<? extends AProxy> getProxyClass(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
      Get the proxy class for the given class If the proxy class has already been proxied then the previously generated proxy class will be returned
      static ProxyFactory staticFactory()
      Get the static proxy factory that uses the default proforma library

    • Method Detail

      • dynamicFactory

        public static ProxyFactory dynamicFactory(com.k2.Proforma.ProformaLibrary library)
        Create an instance of the ProxyFactory that will generate its proxies from the given proforma library
        Parameters:
        library - The proforma library that will be used to provide proformas to generate the proxy classes java source.
        Returns:
        An instance of the ProxyFactory linked to the given proforma library

      • staticFactory

        public static ProxyFactory staticFactory()
        Get the static proxy factory that uses the default proforma library
        Returns:
        The static proxy factory

      • getProxy

        public <T> T getProxy(T target,
                      java.lang.Class<?>... handlers)
        Get a instance implementing the AProxy interface that extends the class of the given target and linked to the given array of invocation handlers
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object being proxied
        Parameters:
        target - The object to be proxied
        handlers - The invocation handlers to handle invocations of the public methods of the proxied target. Each handler class must be an implementation of the TypedInvocationHandler and the first handler must be an implementation of the TargettedInvocationHandler
        Returns:
        The proxy to the proxied target that will call the inocation handlers in reverse order until the method on the target is invoked.

      • getProxy

        public <T> T getProxy(java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                      java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler handler)
        Create an instance of the proxy class for the given class and set its invocation handler to the given invocation handler
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object being proxied
        Parameters:
        cls - The class for which a proxy is required
        handler - The handler that will handle method invocation on the proxy class
        Returns:
        A proxy that exends the given class and whos public methods are handled by the given invocation handler.

      • getProxyClass

        public java.lang.Class<? extends AProxy> getProxyClass(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
        Get the proxy class for the given class If the proxy class has already been proxied then the previously generated proxy class will be returned
        Parameters:
        cls - The class to be proxied
        Returns:
        The proxy class of the given class
